articles.description: WATCH OUT, iPhone owners! Apple smartphones can be crashed by a string of text sent in text messages or shared on websites or online forums. The text causes your iPhone to freeze.

articles.author: Gareth Corfield
articles.title: We could have pwned Microsoft Teams with a GIF, claims Israeli infosec outfit - The Register
articles.description: Proof-of-concept vuln patched a week ago
articles.content:
A vulnerability existed in Microsoft's Slack for Suits tool, Teams, that could have let a remote attacker take over accounts by simply sending a malicious GIF, infosec researchers claim.
The pwn-with-GIF vuln was possible, said Cyberark, thanks to two compro… [+2312 chars]

articles.author: Jeremy White
articles.title: Apple Magic Keyboard review: what the iPad needed all along - Wired.co.uk
articles.description: The new flagship iPad keyboard accessory is so well designed, so well-built and so useful that it transforms the experience of using an Apple tablet
articles.content:
You have to wonder whether the designers and developers at Apple were elated or despondent when the new iPad Pro announced last month was eclipsed by an accessory. 
Was that the plan all along? Despite arriving typically late to the party for tablet covers w… [+5922 chars]

articles.title: Treasury in talks to roll-out ‘unicorn rescue’ package - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Any support would come on top of existing schemes to support start-ups
articles.content:
Britains billion-dollar start-ups could be handed a government lifeline as part of rescue plans under discussion to support firms too big to benefit from the Treasurys £250m bailout fund. 
Later stage technology firms, known as unicorns that are valued at mo… [+1185 chars]

articles.title: Mighty CPU rival to Intel and AMD set to shake up the market - TechRadar
articles.description: French company SiPearl enters the fray
articles.content:
The announcement of Amazons Graviton2
